Draw a neighborhood sector glyph

Source: R/neighborhoodSectorGlyph.R
neighborhoodSectorGlyph.Rd

Visualize a spatial neighborhood as a sector-based glyph, where regions are represented as angular sectors and cell types are positioned within each sector according to adjacency relationships.

Usage

neighborhoodSectorGlyph(
  string,
  delimiter_node = "--",
  delimiter_region_celltype = "_",
  adj_matrix,
  radius = 1,
  cell_radius = 0.5,
  region_color_plate = NULL,
  celltype_color_plate,
  region_seq = NULL,
  region_alpha = 0.3,
  edge_color = "gray30",
  sector_boundary_color = "black",
  sector_boundary_linewidth = 0.5,
  edge_linewidth = 0.8,
  cell_size = 3,
  text = TRUE,
  text_vjust = 2,
  text_size = 4
)

Arguments

string

A character string encoding the neighborhood structure, including region and cell type information.

delimiter_node

Character delimiter separating nodes in string. Default is "--".

delimiter_region_celltype

Character delimiter separating region and cell type labels within a node. Default is "_".

adj_matrix

Either a square adjacency matrix defining relationships between nodes in the neighborhood, or a character vector encoding singlet or pairwise adjacency relationships.

radius

Numeric scalar specifying the outer radius of the glyph.

cell_radius

Numeric scalar specifying the radius used for placing cell-type points within each sector.

region_color_plate

Named character vector mapping regions to colors.

celltype_color_plate

Named character vector mapping cell types to colors.

region_seq

Optional character vector specifying the order of regions around the glyph. If NULL, regions are ordered automatically.

region_alpha

Numeric scalar controlling the transparency of region sectors.

edge_color

Color used to draw edges between adjacent nodes.

sector_boundary_color

Color of sector boundaries.

sector_boundary_linewidth

Numeric scalar specifying the line width of sector boundaries.

edge_linewidth

Numeric scalar specifying the line width of edges.

cell_size

Numeric scalar specifying the size of cell-type points.

text

Logical; whether to draw text labels.

text_vjust

Numeric value controlling vertical justification of text.

text_size

Numeric scalar specifying the size of text labels.

Value

A ggplot object representing the neighborhood sector glyph.

On this page
